intro: Gymnotheca laxa, commonly known as the lax gymnotheca, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically ovate to elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pale pink to white in color. Gymnotheca laxa is native to tropical and subtropical regions, where it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments, such as undergrowth in forests or along riverbanks.
